intro: Pedicularis obliquigaleata, commonly known as the slant-lipped lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive slanted lip. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, preferring rocky or gravelly soils. Pedicularis obliquigaleata is often found in open meadows and forest edges, where it can receive adequate sunlight for its photosynthetic needs.
